# endFrame

**Type Property**

The size and location of the window or view at the end of the animation.

## Declaration

```swift
static let endFrame: NSViewAnimation.Key
```

## Discussion

The size and location are specified by an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSRect] structure encoded in an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSValue] object. This property is optional. If it is not specified, `NSViewAnimation` uses the frame of the window or view at the start of the animation. If the target is a view and the end frame is empty, the view is hidden at the end.

## Keys

- **effect**: An effect to apply to the animation.
- **startFrame**: The size and location of the window or view at the start of the animation.
- **target**: The target of the animation.
